Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: parisfornia
Reviews.Content: Our family (+ 2 young boys) recently stayed at the Home Suites & Spa and were very happy. The staff was very welcoming. We appreciated having 2 separate rooms (large bed for parents + 2 converted sofa beds for the boys) with a nice sized bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms/bathrooms very clean. We even had our own terrace. The complimentary bottles of water each day was also a nice touch. You can also buy snacks and drinks at the little shop next door. The location is a short walk from all the sights in Sultanamet with lots of restaurants nearby. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “it is the best in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: abosamra1981
Reviews.Content: I like it very very much it is the best in Istanbul, it is near the Tram, the nice reinsurance, the historical places ( waking)

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Emil D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Home Suites for one week. Room was comfortable and attractive. The Location perfect for tourists. The staff was excellent(Seda and Matt were especially helpful). The little grocery store next to the hotel was a convenient source of cheap bottled spring water. Every morning on the our trip to tram or Bazaar, etc. We walked through Hippodrome beside the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay also for families”
Reviews.Author: Erikjacq
Reviews.Content: We (Dutch familie two adults and two kids 13 and 9) stayed six nights at the hotel end of February 2012. We have had a great time. The room (suite) was spacious, clean and very well equiped. Breakfast and the restaurant are fantastic and the personel is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia Mosque, Topkapi palace, Grand Bazaar, public transport (tram) etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ein super passendes Hotel fÃ¼r einen Trip nach Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Holger-Sterni
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for a sightseeing-trip and we booked these hotel, because it was located in the old city. It was a amazing stay in that hotel. The staff are soo kind and helpful and it was a pleasure to know them all. We had really nice rooms and we were surprised for the beautyful interieur. We want to come back for sure, especially also for the really nice rooms, the marvellous staff and the short distances to every important sights. GO AHED ! It will impress you a lot....we are sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location in Old City”
Reviews.Author: pat c
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, located in Old City of Istanbul, Turkey. Very close to Blue Mosque, maybe 4 city blocks away. Also located to some very good restaurants, like the Hippodrome, outstanding food and atmosphere. The Home Suites was very comfortable, very friendly and helpful people working there. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel restaurant served delicious food. We ate breakfast every morning and had two dinners at the hotel while visiting during our week in Istanbul. While we did not use the hotel Turkish Bath or the exercise room, they both looked very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly and very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: SLR1
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 29th January for 6 nights in this hotel and have no complaints at all. The staff are all incredibly helpful and from the moment we arrived we were made very welcome. The hotel was very clean and the food was tasty. The facilities in the hotel are excellent with free wifi throughout, a well equipped gym which I used solely throughout my stay and even a fee sauna which the lovely staff switched on for me when requested. The hotel is well located, only a few minutes walk from the major tourist attractions of the city and an even shorter walk down to the sea front. If I visit Istanbul again then I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Thanks for making our holiday so good :-)

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that feels like home”
Reviews.Author: MayWatson
Reviews.Content: In simple words, from the first moment my husband and I set foot at this hotel, we felt we were home.The place was cozy.The staff was very friendly with us especially the morning shift, Shereen, Seda, Gulu, Mustapha, and Saleh. They were always willing to stay late to serve us breakfast. We were treated like family.Our room was always clean and tidy.We liked their Sauna room. Since we did not bring our laptop with us, they let us take the guest labtop to our room a couple of times. You ask for something, they would jump to help you. We won't forget our friend Forqan for the night shift; he recommended what places we needed to see in Turkey. In addition to that, the hotel is in close proximity to all touristic attrctions. Every thing is within a walking distance, Ayasofia, The Blue Mosque, The Grand Bazzar, The Spice Bazzar. We would definitely come back. If we had to find any faults with any thing, it would be that the walls were terribly thin. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place, Excellent Location, Beautiful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tattard
Reviews.Content: Definitely not your regular mid-range Best Western; we chose this hotel because it was ranked well by Tripadvisor - location couldn't be better, close to all the places but in a quaint charming part of Sultanahmet, across the road from Little Ayasophia which is very interesting, Romanesque-medieval church converted to mosque which you have to visit if you're wanting a taste of a less touristy attraction. The hotel itself is small, more boutique-hotel than the usual impersonal Best Western Hotels. The lobby's rather small but the breakfast area's adequate; breakfast was good although not exceptional and the exercise room's well equipped. Our room was Okay given we have two kids, my sister and her husband had lots of room and were better off on the top floor with a great view. I really have nothing to whine about, this hotel exceeded most of my expectations, was comfortable, clean, safe and occasionally touched on luxury. The staff, especially the morning shift deserve praise!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: debnath
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its location although it is a bit pricey. We were travelling with 2 teenagers and needed a bigger room-the only one I'd recommend is on the 4th floor with the terrace and a great view. The staff were friendly-a special mention of Saleh. It is small facility but well organized. We tried the restaurant for dinner and it was good. The breakfast is adequate with made to order omlettes and fried eggs. You could walk and see all the attractions within 10 minutes radius. The area seemed quite safe as we walked in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is highly over rated”
Reviews.Author: Sultanahmet2012
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel has been highly rated apart from location and the staff there's nothing to the hotel there are no sound proof insulation on walls you can hear every little noise from rooms which was very annoying the windows are stated as double glazing but again the are 2 set of glass on windows it certainly wasn't double glazing you could hear the traffic all day including people speaking outside and all night the cars tooting. The breakfast very bland and dry not fit for a hotel rating for 4 and a half I would grade this as a very good 3 star hotel. There's no lounge. The breakfast bar is very tight and can get crowded. We got back yesterday the noise in the hotel put me off no I would not use this hotel again. We stayed a week and on many occasions got woken up by noise in the hotel and from the noise outside and we were at the 3rd floor. I must give credit to miss seda and mr salih for there hospitality. when I told the noise problem to the staff they said it wad the first they had an issue......

Reviews.Title: “Within Walking Distance to Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Jonezy63
Reviews.Content: The long flight(s) to Istanbul were exhausting, but we were delighted tto quickly find the driver for our hotel. It certainly helped not to have to figure out transportation by bus or taxi! We were not on a cruise or with a tour group, having met another family member at the airport. Our room was accommodating and clean. Since there were three people in our party, we had two single beds and a small sofa bed. Personnel were helpful and friendly. This hotel is located within short walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bascilia Cisterns and the Hippodrome. Situated in a boutique hotel region, there were small shops and restaurants nearby. The best part about the hotel was its morning buffet! Many different cheeses, meats, sweets, breads, fruits and drinks were available. Well worth it. Would I go back again? Yes, I would. Using the "good ole" AAA guide and the one provided by the hotel, we easily moved around Istanbul to see ALL the tourist stops and sample the culture of such a grand city!

Reviews.Title: “girly trip to istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H
Reviews.Content: Fabulous small hotel less than 10 minutes from blue mosque and hagia sophia. A bit noisy in the mornings, but more than made up for by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Able to help with anything from using the trams, booking trips, recommeding places to eat, advice on haggling and where to get the best deals. Probably better to be 3rd or 4th floor, as I said a bit noisy on the 2nd. Ask salih for a cosmopolitan, they are lethal, and different every time. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “American Family Vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HistorySeeker77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Premier for 4 days, 21 - 24 NOV. Can't recommend it enough. Excellent room (we had a junior suite) for a good price. The staff was exceptional, welcoming and accommodating, from getting cabs for us, to telling us where to find whirling dervishes, to making sure we were all happy and comfortable. My wife is very picky on cleanliness, and this was one very clean hotel. The breakfast was great, and they make great eggs, too. Beds and bathtubs were very comfortable and clean. Even our cleaning lady was very sweet to our girls. We didn't get a chance to use it, but they have a great gym downstairs and Turkish Bath as well. We discovered there's a great view from the top of the hotel and it's a perfect spot for taking pictures. We have a 2 and 4 year old, and the location is perfect even for them; everything within 5-10 minutes walk. Again, with a family in Istanbul and Turkey our first time, this ended up being an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolynNina N
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - great position down the hill from the Blue Mosque, quiet, small and friendly. The staff were extremely helpful, the bedroom was lovely - great colours and new everything, the bathroom was perfect with speakers from the TV if you wanted to listen to the news! It faced onto the side street so very little traffic. This might have been diffferent elsewhere in the hotel. Breakfast was plentiful and relaxed. We found it the perfect respite from the busy-ness of the city. We would recommend it for a short break. In our deal it was priced accurately we thought but there was no lounge so once out of the room on the last day there was nowhere to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lori N
Reviews.Content: Great location. We had top floor view room and enjoyed our stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive compared to services”
Reviews.Author: alltayyib
Reviews.Content: it is a very tiny hotel with noisy surroundings. I have rented a deluxe room with jacoozie and the total area would not exceed 25 m2 and i paid a fortune. corridors are very tiny. hotel is close to major attractions but you could find tons of hotels that are 25% of its price nearby and with same quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stevej7966
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at this hotel, had a great suite on the 4th floor overlooking the Bosphorus. Less than 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sophia. Great staff that was very helpful with dinner recommendations and getting taxis. Coffee and tea service in the room was convenient, buffet breakfast was ample.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kev M
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to turkey, we found an absolute gem of a hotel!!!, the staff, overwhelmingly sincere and helpful! made us feel soooo at home! the kindness shown by them made us feel part of the family,salih is one in a million!, the rooms are clean, fresh linen etc, views from the rooftop terrace fab!..,try the cheese and hams and tasty tomato,s at the breakfast bar, or freshly scrambled eggs...blue mosque aya sofia just a few minutes walk away, topkapi palace a must see, how the sultans lived, try the mackeral fillets fresh from the sea, on a bread roll with tomato,s corriander and onion, by the galata bridge., just up the street from hotel, you will find the aya sofia kebab house, go hungry, the portions are big, try the world famous pudding house for a great feed!.....take in the sites and smells of a wonderful city .......wonderful people!, we fell in love with istanbul and plan to return next year. kev and gail, west midlands, england.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, but rather disappointed with hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scottie920
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here early Sept. The hotel is well located within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, although this is uphill on cobbled streets so might not suit everyone. We were allocated a smallish room on the 2nd floor overlooking the street. No view at all. The room was clean and well presented. Tea/Coffee making facilities, Mini Bar (charge) Mineral water free as recommend you do not drink tap water. Bath robes and slippers. Bathroom is small with over bath shower but nice fresh towels and plenty of soaps shampoo conditioner etc.. TV limited channels CNN/BBC World. Biggest problem was unexpectedly from an old building the walls were very thin and we were awoken with the sound of neighbours TV, talking and bathroom noise. Breakfast was typically european, cold meats cheeses etc. Staff would always ask if guests would like eggs freshly cooked. We used the Sauna and turkish bath, but these had to be turned on when we got there so took a while to heat up. The staff are fantastic, and always offered a friendly smile and help when needed. I feel for the cost paid I would have expected more in regards to the hotel room from a 5 star hotel. The staff are 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: knowj
Reviews.Content: We have rarely been so well treated and welcomed. The room was clean and adequate with nice fresh linens. We stayed at the end of August and the weather was ideal 80F+/-. The terrace in front on the street was magic. We met there the world famous Salih bey and were honored to be his guest. All the staff was so receptive and accommodating. I reccomend this establishment so highly that there aren't the words to describe the feeling. We were so glad we didn't go to a cold high rise place with doorman etc. We ventured out to see some sights to find our home waiting for us with a nice glass of wine, bira and meze, sometimes RRRRRRaki. There's a phone store/internet cafe across the street glad to help your mobile to work and I really had no worries on a great vacation thanks to feeling so 'home' away from home. Say hello to Duman. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: dranson2600
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break at this small hotel which is ideally situated being within easy walking distance of many of the popular sites. All the staff where extremely friendly and attentive and the food was excellent, the rooms and facilities where spotlessly clean, we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “The staff were helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Regina B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly rates on tip advisor but was not what we expected. The hotel was very central but on extremely busy road. Breakfast was were fairly standart. Location in the old town near was great.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll stay again in the home suites if we come back”
Reviews.Author: Riyadh T
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the historical part of Istanbul. Historical sites and public transportation near by. Very well furished rooms and clean hotel with very friendly and helpful staff that made us feel at home. Breakfast well presented with nice variety of food. Free Wi-Fi for internet connection was an added bonus. The executive suites have a terrace with varying view of the sea and Istanbul. We know where we will stay if we visit Istanbul again and we'll recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, incredibly friendly staff, would strongly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennifer0257
Reviews.Content: The hotel felt like a small inn rather than a chain hotel. The staff welcomed us in and out each time and took very personal care of us. When we mentioned that we liked soccer, one of the staff members arranged for us to be taken to a local game by his apartment mate and got us tickets. The food service staff was friendly, accomodating and very helpful with a gluten intolerance. The food was also delicious. The rooms we stayed in were spotless, very comfortable, and beautifully decorated. There was a small and clean gym and hamman in the basement. The location was perfect, a close walk to all sites in the old city and on a quiet corner out of the busy traffic. When we left after 4-5 days, we felt like we were leaving friends. We will definitely return. We are a family with teenage children, but we also saw the staff fussing over families with very young children and taking great care of adults.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, Special Staff”
Reviews.Author: AmroZidan
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for 6 days with my family, my wife and 2 kids, it was one of the best hotel i saw, location is perfect, walking distance to many places, clean rooms, good food, The Hotel Staff is the best, very helpful very friendly, willing to help you as much as they can Specially Saleh, Zainab and Mustafa, we have enjoyed it too much, if I'll be going back to Istanbul, diffidently this hotel will be my first choice, it is very much recommended to any one

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: water_lili_88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located - walking distance to the old town sites and you can take a tram to Taksim or Bosphorous. The hotel has a nice haman/sauna facilities, a gym, and the rooms themselves have a nice private jacuzzi bathtub - note there is no pool in the hotel. The suite is nicely decorated, a good size and the bed is extremely comfortable. The breakfast was good (though perhaps could have more variety in the hot food). The staff are all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the staff, liked the room (a lot), LOVED the location”
Reviews.Author: Cody-Anne
Reviews.Content: Just want to start out by saying that Turkish folks love kids, and the staff here went above and beyond for my husband, myself and my 2 year old daughter. The staff are what make this very nice hotel extraordinary. Our room was nice, we reserved the Deluxe Suite, so paid around 230â‚¬ a night, and stayed for 3 nights. We had plenty of space, hardwood floors, crisp, clean linens, a lounge area with a little sofa, a tiled and somewhat spacious bathroom with good water pressure. We could hear our neighbors in the next room (they were loud, it was late, only happened once), and we could hear the call to prayer pretty clearly (although I like that, I think it's pretty cool, but just to warn you, the room isn't sound proof). Not the most comfortable bed I have slept in. Some of the finishings in the room were poorly done, ie: the door trim wasn't even close to flush with the door, but that's just getting petty, isn't it? The breakfast buffet was included in our price and delicious. Our last evening we ate our dinner at the hotel, and I am not exagerating, it was the best meal we had in Istanbul! The experience was lovely too, and I attribute most of that to the fabulous, fabulous staff they have working there! The location is exactly where you want to stay when you are in Istanbul. It isn't fancy on the Bosphorous, but it is minutes from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and many many other attractions. We walked everywhere. Excellent, excellent, excellent location! Overall, you should stay here, but perhaps don't spend the extra money for the bigger room because the reason this hotel shines is their service and their location!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel , great location to site seeing”
Reviews.Author: nghosni
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a very nice surprise, it is a small hotel but very clean , reasonably priced and new. The room was big with new modern bathroom. Location is great as we were planning on visiting Hagia Sophia, the blue mosque and the Top kapi and they were all walking distance from hotel, we also walked to the grand bazaar, I loved the dolma pasha but had to take a taxi , taxi drivers are horrible and definitely will con you if you are not careful. I would definitely recommend this hotel , restaurant is small but we dint need more than this for breakfast. Staff were very friendly too and they spoke good English which is a problem with taxi drivers and many shop owners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent end to a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: kathkimb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our 12 day cruise of the Black Sea and it was great. The hotel is very clean and conveniently located but it was the excellent service of the staff that made it wonderful. If you are ever in Istanbul I would highly recommend this as your #1 place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Hospitable, and an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Three_0f_Us
Reviews.Content: It's all been said in the many other superlative reviews of The Home Suites, so perhaps all I should add is that it really is that nice a place to stay. Certainly there are fancier, more expensive hotels in Istanbul, but what distinguishes this one is the easygoing and honest hospitality of the staff -- exceptional even in a city whose hospitality is legendary -- as well as the prime location (close to the attractions of the Old City, but in a relatively quite, relaxed neighborhood. And very near the sea, which means pleasant breezes and views). The restaurant is quite good, service is, of course, excellent, and the sidewalk tables afford a wonderful, relaxing vantage for watching the world go by. The spa's nice, too. All I can say is we know where we'll stay in Istanbul from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made a good place great”
Reviews.Author: tealsurf
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good, but its staff made it great. From the moment we arrived and were greeted warmly by Salih, at the desk Orhan was forever gracious, and helpful. He would draw us maps by hand to give us great directions. Arranged whatever we asked and made our trip such a pleasure. Our initial room was very nice, yet during our stay the Manager Mustafa unsolicited, offered to upgrade us when another room was available. He commented a large family with 3 kids was moving in next door to our old room and was considerate enough to move us before we were even aware of our new neighbors. The hotel is very conveniently located in the old town area and made for easy walking to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, plus easy access to the Tramway to get us to many other sites we visited. The hotel alone Iâ€™d give good marks for convenience, cleanliness and comfort of rooms. The Staff experience we had is what made it such a wonderful warm experience.

Reviews.Title: “A True Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: PDX-World
Reviews.Content: Our stay this past week at The Homes Suites & Spa in Istanbul was nothing short of an absolute delight! Its location is perfectâ€¦just a few minutesâ€™ walk from many of the major sights, including the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and the Basilica Cistern. Our room was large, spotless, and very nicely furnished. The air conditioning system is controlled in the room directly, and provided a welcome respite from the heat and humidity of Istanbul. Breakfasts at the Homes Suites are a joy. There are plenty of choices for everyone, including a selection of Turkish olives, meats, cheeses, and breads. More typical European fare is also available including eggs, toast, and cereals. The breakfast room is open and light, and is staffed by people who will greet you with a big smile and an eager willingness to help you discover some of Turkeyâ€™s taste treats. The hotel staff deserves special mention. Everyone at the front desk is knowledgeable and very helpful not only in arranging tours and airport transfers, but in recommending restaurants and making the necessary restaurant reservations. Whenever weâ€™d leave the hotel by taxi, either Saleh or Murat (two exceptionally nice guys!) would first talk with the taxi driver, explain where we were off to, and to confirm the approximate taxi fare. Really wonderful service! The hotelâ€™s reservations manager, Mr. Mustafa Kavak, deserves our special thanks as well. Not only did he ensure that our reservations were properly handled, as were our airport transfers, Mustafa always greeted us with a smile and took a genuine interest in what we were seeing, where we were eating, and just how much we were enjoying his lovely country. Thank you, Mustafa! Lastly, Iâ€™d also like to mention the hotels maids. Too often theyâ€™re overlooked, yet theyâ€™re the ones that often keep our rooms sparkling and thus make our stays that much more enjoyable. The maids at The Home Suites do a meticulous job of keeping the room spotless, and despite their many duties they always took the time to offer us a smile, a â€œMerhaba!â€� (Hello!), and even taught us a few words of basic Turkish. If Istanbul is your destination, and youâ€™re hoping to have a splendid stay, youâ€™ll find The Homes Suites and Spa to be a â€œTurkish delight!â€�

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Pietjie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights when we first arrived in Istanbul. We arrived at the hotel 9am Sunday morning to be given a very warm welcome by the staff. Our room was ready and our bags were at the door as we alighted from the lift. After a long flight from Sydney we enjoyed a shower and then went down stairs for a coffee. Breakfast was still on and the Manager offered not only free coffee but breakfast as well. We had not booked our accommodation for our return to Istanbul after our Legends of Turkey Tour but did not hesitate to book this hotel for a further 3 nights on our return. The Staff made us so welcome and nothing was to much trouble for them. A room not on the road is preferable as it can be a bit noisy earlier in the night. The most comfortable bed in all the hotels we stayed in during our tour of Turkey. We loved Turkey and would return to this hotel if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel and the most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Fariba2011
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is certainly a 5 star hotel. Although is a small homely hotel but the quality of the rooms are amazing. The sea view is gorgeous. The staff are extremely polite and helpful. "Morat and Salih" were both really lovely, and made our time in Istanbul very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, outstanding and warm welcome from all the staff : we loved Istanbul and our hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDLinParis
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days early June in Istanbul. It was our first trip in a non western country with our two sons (7 and 11). And we found the perfect base to discover this wonderful city. It is very well located, close too many sites and in a lively area. Staff advised us and booked on some of our activities (hamman, 1/2 day cruise), gave us good restaurants advices without pushing them. They were above all incredibly friendly and welcoming to us and the children, just like most of the inhabitants we met with. We had a last floor suite with a lovely terrace, rooms were comfortable, with good beds, and the breakfast was a limited choice but all fresh including somehome cooked Turkish pastries, pies and delights.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with nice rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tmjensen
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 fantastic days in Istanbul where we stayed at the Best Western Premier The home suites and Spa. (we were a family of 4 plus granddad. Had 2 rooms) The hotel is walking distance from all the main attractions in Sulanahmet, and really close to the Blue Mosque.The streets around the hotel have a fair amount of traffic as does most of Sultanahmet and Istanbul, but noice was not a problem in the hotel or rooms. The rooms were excellent. Clean, great beds, and nice bathrooms. The spa section in the basement was a nice extra in such a relative small hotel (fitness, sauna, turkish bath, masage) However what stood out most was the excellent service from all the friendly staff. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: CarrieBradshaw3
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights last week, after booking a last minute business trip. Having never been to istanbul before, and travelling as a lone female I played safe and booked a branded hotel. I'm so glad I booked this one! The hotel was clean, comfortable and a real home from home. The room was spacious with a luxurious bathroom (jacuzzi bath) and a comfortable bed with good quality bed linen. I've rated 4 instead of 5 for sleep quality as the parquet floor in the rooms means that the tv sound carries. The tvs are set to quite a loud volume when you first switch them on and I could hear the tv from next door. There is also the call to prayer in the night! After attracting some unwanted attention from some Turkish men in daylight hours, I didn't venture out after dark so ate in the hotel. The menu wasn't extesnive, but the food was fresh and tasty. There was a good selection at breakfast too. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. Zainep on reception called me taxis each day, gave me local information and was very helpful. Salih is a complete gentleman, he also helped me out with local information, directions etc. He was also nice to chat to as and when I saw him around the hotel. I would thoroughly recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, welcoming, great location!”
Reviews.Author: PavlinaPraha
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in. A new hotel with everything you need. I would recomend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Made our week in Istanbul perfect”
Reviews.Author: Karaikudi
Reviews.Content: We did not book our hotel initially at the Home Suites. We were staying at another hotel that was terrible and we started walking around Sultanhamet. Mustafa, at the Home Suites welcomed us and provided a wonderful room at a great price. The room was beautiful, with a comfortable bed and nicely appointed bathroom. We enjoyed the breakfast overall especially the made to order eggs, pancakes and espresso that was included. The variety of foods was great, though the cheeses and vegetables and breads could have been fresher sometimes. More than the rooms, was the service provided. Mustafa, Salih and the rest of the staff were warm, provided lots of assistance whether we needed toothpaste, directions or recommendations for the best Baklava in town. We are so happy this hotel is doing brisk business and is expanding. We will definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and thank the staff for providing a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: shadi014
Reviews.Content: We had a marvellous stay in BEST WESTERN Premier The Home Suites & Spa, Istanbul. It has a wonderful location within walking distances of many major historical monuments such as AyaSofia, Blue Mosque, Top Capi Museum, the entrance to Grand Bazar, the tram station and so on. Our suite was meticulously clean. The facilities were flawless. The staff couldn't be friendlier. The staffs including Zeinab, Orhan, Goli, Saleh, Farok and all others were amazingly friendly and helpful. This was my second visit to Istanbul after more than 30 years. From what I remember from my first visit, I wasn't impressed at all. The city had changed to the extent beyond anything I was expecting. But I am glad to say that what has made me so impressed this time is hugely owed to the pleasantness and hospitality of the staff of the hotel. It is a small hotel with 20 rooms, a tiny lobby and a small restaurant adjacent to the lobby. But everything is in good proportion. The breakfast was very good with a very good variety of very good quality food. Not all the rooms benefited from the stunning view that our suite did. The suite we'd occupied had a bedroom with a very comfortable twin bed and a living room with two single sofa beds. The living room was a bit compact for two beds. It had a sliding patio window opening into a massive balcony. A bit too big for such a small suite. They couldâ€™ve dragged the window a meter or two further into the balcony to make a much bigger room though I could imagine the appreciation of the hotel's summer guests when watching spectacular sunrise and sunset at Bosphor from that balcony. The bathroom had a very well-functioning shower and a Jacuzzi bath tub. The linens and towels were of good quality. Each room had its own flat TV. A free safe was available in the living room. Due to the size of both rooms, there was no dressing table in either of them. There was one big mirror in the living room. The bedroom could have done with a small mirror on the wall. The fitness facilities and sauna and the Turkish bath downstairs were impeccably clean. We booked the hotel as part of a package so it was very reasonably priced but roomsâ€™ tariffs were noticeably higher. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB POSITION AND WELCOMING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: princessleahthefirst
Reviews.Content: Booked as a Secret Location via a last minute website and was very pleasantly surprised by the result. The Hotel could not have been more welcoming from the moment we were picked up at the airport by the Hotel's driver. Unsure if we had to pay the driver but no it was all dealt with by the Hotel. We had a Junior suite with city room which i believe is their basic room but it was excellent and worthy of a greater price ( we paid Â£92 a night). OK the view was not great but if you are positioned in Old town Sultanahmet you will have to be really lucky to have a sea view unless you are in the Four seasons Hotel. Don't expect to be surrounded by manicured gardens and swimming pools like a Beach Holiday because you are in a bustling busy city but for us that added to the charm. Beautiful bed which resulted in great nights sleep and tastefully decorated with period furniture.Lovely Bathroom with Jacuzzi Bath and usual bathrobes, slippers and towels / gels etc. Staff were very accomodating and answered all our questions , giving directions to restaurants we wanted to find etc . You will find at least six to eight great restaurants tipped by tripadvisor / DK eyewitness Travel within five minute walk. We only had Breakfast at the Hotel but that was a good start to the day with a selection of cheeses , meats, scrambled eggs, great fresh bread, tea, coffee, juices and obviously various turkish sweet cakes, honey etc. Set us up nicely for the day. The best bit about this modern boutique Hotel is the position of it in relation to walking to The Blue Mosque , Haghia Sophia, Grand Bazaar , Topkapi Palace and the vibrant area of Divanyolu street. You can be in the heart of it all within five minutes. We took advantage of going to the Blue Mosque late afternoon in between prayers ( hotel told us prayer times) after all the tourist bus's had gone home and what a difference that made with probably a tenth of the crowds only present. All in all a hidden gem within the Old Town which surpassed our expectations and if we go back to Istanbul we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly and helpful staff, and great location”
Reviews.Author: TheHoush
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Home Suites hotel. The staff, Orhan, Zeynap, Goli, Saleh, and Mr. Farouk were extremely friendly and really helpful at all times. We had never been to Turkey before and they really helped us out in finding the best restaurants and guided tour deals. They were also able to point us to some non-touristic areas and activities which was much appreciated. The hotel itself is minutes away from many must-see destinations in Istanbul: The Blue mosque, Ayasoffia, Topkapi palace, not to mention the fish market where you can sample the fresh catch of the day from an array of restaurants. Overall we had a great time in Istanbul and this was partly due to our choice of hotel, and in particular its friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and conveniently located hotel in the heart of the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: LRWN4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Home Suites for 5 days in February. We found the staff very hospitable and friendly. They were able to easily accomodate us despite a late check-in time and an initial problem finding our booking. They also allowed us to change rooms to a higher floor. The hotel itself is pretty and conveniently located within short walking distance of the Blue Mosque and other sights of the Sultanahmet. We found it an excellent base to explore the rest of the city. The rooms were large, clean and attractive with good bathrooms including jacuzzi bath. The hotel also has a small gym area with treadmills, exercise bikes and basic weights which we were able to use regularly. It also has a sauna and hamam room which were both very pleasant. We would thoroughly recommend the hotel for anyone looking to base themselves in the Sultanahmet area. Our thanks to all the staff for a memorable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A well located, friendly and extremely helpful 'home from home'”
Reviews.Author: chimpette
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived, having been collected from the airport, we were made to feel totally comfortable. The room was a very good size, luxuriously decorated and had all of the amenities we required, including a good speed wifi internet connection and a safe. The bathroom was nicely designed, with the added luxury of a jacuzzi bath tub. Everything was spotlessly clean and new, the bed very comfortable and large. The view was of a local street, but the windows were large and the room had plenty of light. We soon grew to love the sound of the muezzin singing and the local traders pushing their carts along the road. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff - they were able to answer any questions we had, and to arrange anything that we needed during our stay. The location was excellent for visiting many historical and cultural sites, with easy tram access to the rest of the city/transport network. Granted, the immediate area beyond the hotel was a little 'touristy', but not unattractively so (indeed, the nearby parks and buildings were beautiful) and easily avoided if you wanted. We weren't that impressed by the food available in the hotel - we preferred to eat out, as there are so many cheap and amazing local places to eat that we were a bit spoiled for choice - but if you're tired after a long day out you can have a decent dinner there at not too expensive a price. We didn't get a chance to use the hotel's (free) spa and fitness centre during our trip, but it's a nice additional extra to have to hand if you want to chill out. To sum up the experience - this is an excellent, well located and luxuriously comfortable place to stay at a very reasonable price, especially if it's your 1st time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel”
Reviews.Author: alce97
Reviews.Content: Friendliness and courtesy of the staff who were always there to help and assist in whatever way they could. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Design - Location - Service!”
Reviews.Author: tassosGR
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel (18 rooms & suites in 3 floors) in Sultanahmet. Me and my girlfriend stayed there for 6 nights in January. We liked very much the design, the room was lovely and the hotel itself located in walking distance to all the main attractions in sultanahmet. The view from the room was mostly local houses which was rather interesting (watching the housewifes every morning doing their stuff) and partial sea view. We also appreciated very much the wellness facilities, which were free of charge, and the massage service. For the restaurant I can't really say since I didn't ate not even once in the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and did their best to make our stay as good as possible. The only thing we found to be not as good as the rest, was the breakfast which was kind of limited.. As a sum I can say we had a very pleasant stay there and I think it's a good choice for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kabeers
Reviews.Content: We were actually booked to stay at the Best Western Acropol. When we reached that Hotel, we were very upset to be told that this Hotel was under renovation and we were to be relocated at their sister establishment Best Western Premier Home Suites Spa. With no option, we resigned ourselves to our fate. I was really furious that we were not told of this in advance. [I am surprised that Best Western Acropol is still taking bookings when they cannot accommodate the guests and need to relocate them]. We were received warmly at the Home Suites by the Desk Manager Mr.Faruk and the Maitre d'Hotel Mr.Salih. They quickly reassured us and promised to make our stay comfortable. The room that was initially given to us was changed the following day to a Deluxe suite. It was compact, but clean and cozy. Ours was a family of 4 with 2 teenagers. The room had a separate room with a Queen Bed and there were two sofa-beds in the Living room. This Hotel is relatively new and furnished with good taste. The Buffet Breakfast is very nice with the option of having cooked eggs to your requirement. The Hotel has facilities for a free Turkish Bath, Sauna & Gym. There is free wireless internet access in all rooms, which is boon. The bathtub also has a Jacuzzi. There were two HD TV's in the suite. Complimentary tea/coffee/water is provided in each room every day. The view from the front facing rooms overlooks the Sea of Marmara. The Hotel is ideally located in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul and almost all the major attractions are within walkable distance. We used the Hotel's airport pickup and drop service which costs 25 Euros [50 TL] each way. I would recommend it as the vehicle is spacious and comfortable. The staff are extremely polite and attentive to your concerns. Overall, I must say that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Hotel and would perhaps visit it in future. It was a blessing in disguise that our initial choice was under renovation. Our sincere thanks to all the staff, especially Mr.Salih, Mr.Faruk, Mr.Murat & Ms.Zainab, for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and comfortable big city vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gina190479
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from day one. Superb food in restaurant. Good and relaxing atmosphere. Beautiful rooms, nice bathroom and good location. A good place for staying 12 days in Istanbul in winter.

Reviews.Title: “superb little hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: belkas
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Istanbul with my disabled mother and luckily picked up this little gem of a hotel. We were particularly delighted with the superb service and friendliness of Mostafa, Orhan, Murrat and the lovely Oygur. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Omar

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: harald1969
Reviews.Content: great hotel, fantastic staff, close to all the major sights such as blue mosque, haghia sophia, topkapi palace, underground cisterns etc. The stay in this beautiful hotel was very pleasant with super friendly staff. it is in the 'old' part of town (sultan ahmet district) which is perfect. lots of little shops around, a great atmosphere, a small but beautiful bazar (arras bazar), a street with nice restaurants. all within short walking distance. perfect!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier The Home Suites & Spa
